Project Lead Intern


  1. Home
  2. Experiences
  3. BPI Intern

Overview

Internship with many learning opportunities!

The responsibilities I held in this internship was to revolve around the process of automating business processes through programming. Besides for automating a business process, my role included shadowing the process in its entirety to find opportunities for improvement, as-is and to-be (future state) mappings, and tracking feedback.

The benefits of automating processes is that it eliminates human error, allows the organization to allocate resources, and requires minimal training to use the new automated process that is available at an ad-hoc request.

A takeaway from this internship would be the impact it had on a process for a Pricing department. I was able to successfully automate a business processing from extraction, storage, reporting, and finally to printing. I was able to reduce the process total time by 91%, saving 436 hours of process total time in a year, and ultimately saving the business $36,000/yr. It was very exciting to provide an impact for a business that was measurable.

Tools used
MS Access SQL VBA Javascript

Year
Jan. 2018 - Aug. 2018

Exposure
- Web Automation

- Self taught VBA language


Opportunities

Challeneges

Some challenges I had throughout the internship opportunity was being able to learn a new language like VBA. This became easier over time as I was able to apply my foundational knowledge of object-oriented programming from java. Another challenge initially was adjusting to a professional role, as this internship experience was my first exposure to a professional work setting.

Exposure

The exposure I had during this opportunity was to applying my programming knowledge for automation, presenting to senior leadership, and elaborating on the benefits of automation in the workplace. I also received an in-depth exposure to the business of transporting goods via truckload and freight. I also become exposed to client contracts with UPS.


); }
